query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
1 Contra miglior voler voler mal pugna; 2 onde contra ’l piacer mio, per piacerli, 3 trassi de l’acqua non sazia la spugna.
query.error: **English:** 1 Against a better will, an evil will fights; 2 therefore, against my own pleasure, to please her, 3 I drew the sponge from the water, not satisfied.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
4 Mossimi; e ’l duca mio si mosse per li 5 luoghi spediti pur lungo la roccia, 6 come si va per muro stretto a’ merli;
query.error: **English:** 4 I moved, and my leader moved with me 5 through the swift places, right along the rock, 6 as one goes along a narrow wall to the battlements;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
7 ché la gente che fonde a goccia a goccia 8 per li occhi il mal che tutto ’l mondo occupa, 9 da l’altra parte in fuor troppo s’approccia.
query.error: **English:** 7 for the people who distil drop by drop 8 through their eyes the evil that infects the whole world 9 draw too near on the other side.
query.result: 7 for ða leode ðe wepað dropan bi dropan 8 ðurh heora eagan ðæt yfel ðe ealne middangeard gewemmeð, 9 of ðære oðre healfe ðærto swiðe genealæcað.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
10 Maladetta sie tu, antica lupa, 11 che più che tutte l’altre bestie hai preda 12 per la tua fame sanza fine cupa!
query.error: **English:** 10 Accursed be you, ancient she-wolf, 11 who more than all other beasts are ravenous 12 for your insatiable hunger!
query.result: 10 Afyrsed beo ðu, ealde wylf, 11 ðe ðu mare ðonne ealle oðre deor 12 ðinre gitsunge butan ende gnornað!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
13 O ciel, nel cui girar par che si creda 14 le condizion di qua giù trasmutarsi, 15 quando verrà per cui questa disceda?
query.error: **English:** 13 O heavens, in whose revolutions it seems to be believed 14 that the conditions down here can be changed, 15 when will he come for whom this [she-wolf] will depart?
query.result: 13 Eala heofon, on ðinum ymbscrytum hit is gesewen 14 ðæt ða gesceaftas her on eorðan magon beon awende, 15 hwænne cymeð he ðurh ðone ðeos awæg gewiteð?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
16 Noi andavam con passi lenti e scarsi, 17 e io attento a l’ombre, ch’i’ sentia 18 pietosamente piangere e lagnarsi;
query.error: **English:** 16 We were going with slow and weary steps, 17 and I was paying attention to the shades, whom I heard 18 weeping and lamenting pitifully;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
19 e per ventura udi’ «Dolce Maria!» 20 dinanzi a noi chiamar così nel pianto 21 come fa donna che in parturir sia;
query.error: **English:** 19 and by chance I heard "Sweet Mary!" 20 being called out before us in the weeping 21 as a woman does when she is in labor;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
22 e seguitar: «Povera fosti tanto, 23 quanto veder si può per quello ospizio 24 dove sponesti il tuo portato santo».
query.error: **English:** 22 and then: "You were so poor, 23 as can be seen from that inn 24 where you gave birth to your holy burden."
query.result: 22 and ða eft: "Eala, ðu wære swiðe earm, 23 swa swa hit mæg beon gesewen ðurh ðone eard 24 ðær ðu ðinne halgan byrðe on woruld brohtest."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
25 Seguentemente intesi: «O buon Fabrizio, 26 con povertà volesti anzi virtute 27 che gran ricchezza posseder con vizio».
query.error: **English:** 25 Next I heard: "O good Fabricius, 26 with poverty you preferred virtue 27 rather than possessing great wealth with vice."
query.result: 25 Þa ic ðær æfter ðam gehyrde: "Ea, ðu goda Fabricius, 26 ðu mid ðinre wædlecan woldest ðeah ðone mæran sped 27 ðonne ðu sceoldest mid unrihte ðone miclan weorðscipe habban."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
28 Queste parole m’eran sì piaciute, 29 ch’io mi trassi oltre per aver contezza 30 di quello spirto onde parean venute.
query.error: **English:** 28 These words were so pleasing to me, 29 that I moved forward to learn more 30 about the spirit from whom they seemed to come.
query.result: 28 Þas word wæron me swa swetlice, 29 ðæt ic me ferde forð for to gewitene 30 ymbe ðone gast of ðam ða word comon.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
31 Esso parlava ancor de la larghezza 32 che fece Niccolò a le pulcelle, 33 per condurre ad onor lor giovinezza.
query.error: **English:** 31 He spoke again of the generosity 32 that Nicholas showed to the young women, 33 in order to lead their youth to honor.
query.result: 31 He spræc ða giet ða ofer ða gifa 32 ðe Nicholaus ðam mægdum dyde, 33 ðæt heora geogoðe to wurðmynte gelædde.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
34 «O anima che tanto ben favelle, 35 dimmi chi fosti», dissi, «e perché sola 36 tu queste degne lode rinovelle.
query.error: **English:** 34 "O soul who speakest so well, 35 tell me who you were," I said, "and why alone 36 do you renew these worthy praises.
query.result: 34 "Eala ðu gast ðe swa wel spreces, 35 sege me hwa ðu wære," ic cwæð, "and for hwi ðu ana 36 ðas weorðan lof riniwast."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
37 Non fia sanza mercé la tua parola, 38 s’io ritorno a compiér lo cammin corto 39 di quella vita ch’al termine vola».
query.error: **English:** 37 Your word will not be without mercy, 38 if I return to complete the short journey 39 of that life which flies to its end.
query.result: 37 Ne bið ðin word unmilde, 38 gif ic eft cуме tо ðam lytlan færelde 39 ðæs lifes ðe tо ende hweorfeð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
40 Ed elli: «Io ti dirò, non per conforto 41 ch’io attenda di là, ma perché tanta 42 grazia in te luce prima che sie morto.
query.error: **English:** 40 And he: "I will tell you, not for comfort 41 that I expect from there, but because so much 42 grace shines in you before you die.
query.result: 40 And he cwæð: "Ic ðe secge, na for ðinum frofre 41 ðe ic ðær ondræde, ac for ðære miclan 42 æðelnesse ðe on ðe lihteð ær ðu læte lif."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
43 Io fui radice de la mala pianta 44 che la terra cristiana tutta aduggia, 45 sì che buon frutto rado se ne schianta.
query.error: **English:** 43 I was the root of the evil plant 44 that overshadows all the Christian land, 45 so that good fruit seldom comes from it.
query.result: 43 Ic wæs ðære yflan plantan wyrtruma 44 ðe ealle ða cristnan eorðan oferwreoh, 45 swa ðæt seldan ænig god wæstm of hire cymeð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
46 Ma se Doagio, Lilla, Guanto e Bruggia 47 potesser, tosto ne saria vendetta; 48 e io la cheggio a lui che tutto giuggia.
query.error: **English:** 46 But if Douai, Lille, Ghent, and Bruges 47 could, vengeance would soon be ours; 48 and I ask it of Him who judges all.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
49 Chiamato fui di là Ugo Ciappetta; 50 di me son nati i Filippi e i Luigi 51 per cui novellamente è Francia retta.
query.error: **English:** 49 I was called Hugh Capet; 50 from me were born the Philips and the Louises 51 by whom France is newly ruled.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
52 Figliuol fu’ io d’un beccaio di Parigi: 53 quando li regi antichi venner meno 54 tutti, fuor ch’un renduto in panni bigi,
query.error: **English:** 52 I was the son of a butcher of Paris: 53 when the ancient kings all came to an end, 54 except for one who was dressed in gray,
query.result: 52 Ic wæs sunu sumes flæscmangere of Paris: 53 ða ða ða ealdan cyningas ealle gewendon, 54 buton anum ðe wæs gegyred in græge hrægle,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
55 trova’mi stretto ne le mani il freno 56 del governo del regno, e tanta possa 57 di nuovo acquisto, e sì d’amici pieno,
query.error: **English:** 55 I found myself tightly gripping the reins 56 of the government of the kingdom, and so much power 57 of new acquisition, and so full of friends,
query.result: 55 ic funde me fæste on handa ðone brædel 56 ðæs rices gewealdes, and swa micelne anweald 57 of niwan geearnungum, and swa fulne freonda,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
58 ch’a la corona vedova promossa 59 la testa di mio figlio fu, dal quale 60 cominciar di costor le sacrate ossa.
query.error: **English:** 58 that the widowed crown was promoted 59 to the head of my son, from whom 60 the sacred bones of these people began.
query.result: 58 ðæt ðære wuduwan corone wæs geeaðmet 59 ðæs heafod mines suna, of ðam 60 ðara manna halgan ban began.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
61 Mentre che la gran dota provenzale 62 al sangue mio non tolse la vergogna, 63 poco valea, ma pur non facea male.
query.error: **English:** 61 While the great fear of Provence 62 did not take away the shame from my blood, 63 it was worth little, but still did no harm.
query.result: 61 Þa ða seo micle ege Provencale 62 minum blode ða scame ne benam, 63 lyt wæs wyrðe, ac hit næfre ne derode.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
64 Lì cominciò con forza e con menzogna 65 la sua rapina; e poscia, per ammenda, 66 Pontì e Normandia prese e Guascogna.
query.error: **English:** 64 There he began with force and with deceit 65 his plundering; and afterwards, as amends, 66 he took Ponthieu and Normandy and Gascony.
query.result: 64 Þær he ongann mid strengðe and mid unrihte 65 his reaflac syððan, and æfter þam, for worulde wynne, 66 nam Pontif and Normandig and Gascogne.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
67 Carlo venne in Italia e, per ammenda, 68 vittima fé di Curradino; e poi 69 ripinse al ciel Tommaso, per ammenda.
query.error: **English:** 67 Charles came to Italy and, for amends, 68 made Conradin a victim; and then 69 sent Thomas back to heaven, for amends.
query.result: 67 Carl com on Italie and, forbote, 68 wite mede of Curradin; and ða 69 sendeð Thomas to heofenum, forbote.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
70 Tempo vegg’ io, non molto dopo ancoi, 71 che tragge un altro Carlo fuor di Francia, 72 per far conoscer meglio e sé e ’ suoi.
query.error: **English:** 70 Soon, I see a time, not long from now, 71 when another Charles will come out of France, 72 to make himself and his followers better known.
query.result: 70 Ic geseo ða tid, nis ðæt lange to, 71 ðæt oðer Carel cymð of France, 72 to ðon ðæt he hine sylfne and his mægðe bet cunne.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
73 Sanz’ arme n’esce e solo con la lancia 74 con la qual giostrò Giuda, e quella ponta 75 sì, ch’a Fiorenza fa scoppiar la pancia.
query.error: **English:** 73 Unarmed he goes, and only with the lance 74 with which Judas jousted, and that point 75 so that it makes the belly of Florence burst.
query.result: 73 Utan wæpnum he gæð and ana ðære gāre āna 74 þe Iudas mid wægde, and seo ord swa byt 75 ðæt heo on Florentia ðone wamb forbærst.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
76 Quindi non terra, ma peccato e onta 77 guadagnerà, per sé tanto più grave, 78 quanto più lieve simil danno conta.
query.error: **English:** 76 Therefore, not land, but sin and shame 77 he will gain, for himself so much more grievous, 78 as he counts such loss more slight.
query.result: 76 Forðy ne land, ac synne and scand 77 he ðær geearnað, him sylfum ðy swaðe, 78 swa he ðone wyrsan wyrm mid ealle forðylgð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
79 L’altro, che già uscì preso di nave, 80 veggio vender sua figlia e patteggiarne 81 come fanno i corsar de l’altre schiave.
query.error: **English:** 79 The other, who had already left the ship as a prisoner, 80 I see selling his daughter and bargaining for her 81 as the pirates do with other slaves.
query.result: 79 Se ðe oðer, ðe ðær ær of scipe com, 80 ic geseoh ðæt he his dohtor selleð 81 and ðingieð for ðære swa swa ða sæliðend doð

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
82 O avarizia, che puoi tu più farne, 83 poscia c’ha’ il mio sangue a te sì tratto, 84 che non si cura de la propria carne?
query.error: **English:** 82 O avarice, what more can you do to us, 83 since you have drawn my blood to yourself so much, 84 that it does not care for its own flesh?
query.result: 82 O gifru, hwæt mæg ðu mare don, 83 siððan ðu hæfst min blod to ðe swa geteald, 84 ðæt hit ne ræðð for his agen flæsc?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
85 Perché men paia il mal futuro e ’l fatto, 86 veggio in Alagna intrar lo fiordaliso, 87 e nel vicario suo Cristo esser catto.
query.error: **English:** 85 So that the evil to come and the evil done may seem less to me, 86 I see the fleur-de-lis enter Alagna, 87 and Christ being held captive in his vicar.
query.result: 85 Forðæm ðe me ðincol ðæt yfel toweard and ðæt gedon, 86 ic geseo on Alagna ðone flur-de-lis ingangan, 87 and on his vicare Crist beon gefangen.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
88 Veggiolo un’altra volta esser deriso; 89 veggio rinovellar l’aceto e ’l fiele, 90 e tra vivi ladroni esser anciso.
query.error: **English:** 88 I see him mocked once more; 89 I see the vinegar and gall renewed, 90 and him crucified among living thieves.
query.result: 88 Ic hine eft geseo ðurh hæðene folc 89 edneowe ða bittran bysmor ðolian, 90 and betwux ðam sceððum ahangen.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
91 Veggio il novo Pilato sì crudele, 92 che ciò nol sazia, ma sanza decreto 93 portar nel Tempio le cupide vele.
query.error: **English:** 91 I see the new Pilate so cruel, 92 that this does not satisfy him, but without decree 93 he carries the greedy sails into the Temple.
query.result: 91 Ic geseo ðone niwan Pilatus swa grimme, 92 ðæt ðæt hine ne gefyllo, ac butan dome 93 bær on ðam temple ða gitsendan segel.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
94 O Segnor mio, quando sarò io lieto 95 a veder la vendetta che, nascosa, 96 fa dolce l’ira tua nel tuo secreto?
query.error: **English:** 94 O my Lord, when shall I be glad 95 to see the vengeance that, hidden, 96 makes Your wrath sweet in Your secret place?
query.result: 94 Eala min Drihten, hwanne bið me glæd 95 ðæt ic ða wracu geseo ðe ðu digle 96 wyrcst on ðinum mode ðinre yrre swete?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
97 Ciò ch’io dicea di quell’ unica sposa 98 de lo Spirito Santo e che ti fece 99 verso me volger per alcuna chiosa,
query.error: **English:** 97 What I said about that unique bride 98 of the Holy Spirit, who made You 99 turn toward me for some explanation,
query.result: 97 Þæt ðe ic sæde be ðære anan bryde 98 ðæs Halgan Gastes ðe ðe geworhte 99 ðæt ðu on me woldest ðurh sume rædas smeagan,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
100 tanto è risposto a tutte nostre prece 101 quanto ’l dì dura; ma com’ el s’annotta, 102 contrario suon prendemo in quella vece.
query.error: **English:** 100 is answered to all our prayers 101 as long as the day lasts; but when night falls, 102 we take up the opposite sound instead.
query.result: 100 swa bið geandwyrd eallum urum beden 101 swa lange swa ðes dæg wunað; ac ðonne niht becymð, 102 ðonne we ða widerræde stefne on ðære stowe onfoð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
103 Noi repetiam Pigmalïon allotta, 104 cui traditore e ladro e paricida 105 fece la voglia sua de l’oro ghiotta;
query.error: **English:** 103 We repeated the story of Pygmalion, 104 whom his greedy desire for gold 105 made a traitor, a thief, and a murderer;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
106 e la miseria de l’avaro Mida, 107 che seguì a la sua dimanda gorda, 108 per la qual sempre convien che si rida.
query.error: **English:** 106 and the misery of the miserly Midas, 107 who, because of his greedy request, 108 is always a subject of ridicule.
query.result: 106 and ðæs gitseres Mides yrmðu, 107 ðe his ofermodigan bene folgode, 108 ðurh ða he sceal æfre beon to hleahtre.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
109 Del folle Acàn ciascun poi si ricorda, 110 come furò le spoglie, sì che l’ira 111 di Iosüè qui par ch’ancor lo morda.
query.error: **English:** 109 Everyone remembers the foolish Achan, 110 how he stole the spoils, so that the wrath 111 of Joshua here seems still to bite him.
query.result: 109 Þæs dysigan Achans gehwylc ðonne gemunde, 110 hu he ða herehyrst hrorode, swa ðæt ðæs yrre 111 Iosue her gyt ðinceð ðæt hine bite.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
115 Polinestòr ch’ancise Polidoro; 116 ultimamente ci si grida: “Crasso, 117 dilci, che ’l sai: di che sapore è l’oro?”.
query.error: **English:** 115 Polymestor who killed Polydorus; 116 finally we are shouted at: “Crassus, 117 tell us, since you know: what does gold taste like?”.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
118 Talor parla l’uno alto e l’altro basso, 119 secondo l’affezion ch’ad ir ci sprona 120 ora a maggiore e ora a minor passo:
query.error: **English:** 118 Sometimes one spoke loudly and the other softly, 119 according to the affection that spurred us on, 120 now with a longer and now with a shorter stride.
query.result: 118 Hwilum spræc se oder heah and se oder læge, 119 æfter ðære lufe ðe us on ferð lædde, 120 nu mid maran and nu mid læssan stape:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
121 però al ben che ’l dì ci si ragiona, 122 dianzi non era io sol; ma qui da presso 123 non alzava la voce altra persona».
query.error: **English:** 121 Therefore, at the good that we discussed during the day, 122 earlier I was not alone; but here nearby 123 no other person raised their voice.
query.result: 121 for ði ðam gode ðe we ðæs dæges ræddon, 122 ær ne wæs ic ana; ac her gehende 123 ne hleop ðær oder mannes stefn».

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
124 Noi eravam partiti già da esso, 125 e brigavam di soverchiar la strada 126 tanto quanto al poder n’era permesso,
query.error: **English:** 124 We had already departed from it, 125 and were striving to overcome the road 126 as much as our power permitted us,
query.result: 124 We wæron nu fram ðam asceаðene, 125 and wæron winnende ðone weg oferwinnan 126 swa micel swa us ðære mihte gelæred wæs,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
127 quand’ io senti’, come cosa che cada, 128 tremar lo monte; onde mi prese un gelo 129 qual prender suol colui ch’a morte vada.
query.error: **English:** 127 when I heard, like a thing that falls, 128 the mountain tremble; whereupon a chill seized me 129 such as seizes him who goes to his death.
query.result: 127 ða ic gehyrde, swa sum ðing ðe fealle, 128 ðone munt bifian; ða me ondræd micel 129 swylce ðone ðe to deаðe gæð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
130 Certo non si scoteo sì forte Delo, 131 pria che Latona in lei facesse ’l nido 132 a parturir li due occhi del cielo.
query.error: **English:** 130 Surely Delos did not shake so violently, 131 before Latona made her nest there 132 to give birth to the two eyes of heaven.
query.result: 130 Ne wæs ðæt feor ða ðe ðæt folc onfand, 131 ðæt ða bearn wæron geboren butu, 132 ða ðe ðone grundwong ðurhbræcon.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
133 Poi cominciò da tutte parti un grido 134 tal, che ’l maestro inverso me si feo, 135 dicendo: «Non dubbiar, mentr’ io ti guido».
query.error: **English:** 133 Then from every side a cry began, 134 such that my master turned to me, 135 saying: "Do not fear, while I am guiding you."
query.result: 133 Þa ongan of eallum healfum hream 134 swylc ðætte se mæster onwendan him to, 135 cwæð: "Ne ondræd ðu ðe, ða hwile ðe ic ðe læde."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
136 ‘Glorïa in excelsis’ tutti ‘Deo’ 137 dicean, per quel ch’io da’ vicin compresi, 138 onde intender lo grido si poteo.
query.error: **English:** 136 ‘Glory to God in the highest’ all ‘to God’ 137 they said, from what I understood from those nearby, 138 from which the cry could be understood.
query.result: 136 ‘Gloria in excelsis’ ealle ‘Deo’ 137 cwædon, for ðæm ðe ic fram ðæm neawestum oncneow, 138 ðanon ðæt hream gehiran meahtest.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
139 No’ istavamo immobili e sospesi 140 come i pastor che prima udir quel canto, 141 fin che ’l tremar cessò ed el compiési.
query.error: **English:** 139 We stood there, motionless and suspended, 140 like shepherds who first hear that song, 141 until the trembling ceased and the song ended.
query.result: 139 Þa wæron we stille and gestilde 140 swa swa hyrdas ðe ær ðone sang gehyrdon, 141 oð ðæt ðæt bifung and ðæt beofung geswac.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
142 Poi ripigliammo nostro cammin santo, 143 guardando l’ombre che giacean per terra, 144 tornate già in su l’usato pianto.
query.error: **English:** 142 Then we resumed our holy journey, 143 looking at the shadows that lay on the ground, 144 now returned to their accustomed weeping.
query.result: 142 ða we eft ongunnon ðone halige weg, 143 sceawiende ða scagan ðe ðær on ðam lande lægon, 144 eft gecyrrede to ðam gewunanlican weope.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
145 Nulla ignoranza mai con tanta guerra 146 mi fé desideroso di sapere, 147 se la memoria mia in ciò non erra,
query.error: **English:** 145 No ignorance ever with so much warfare 146 made me desirous of knowing, 147 if my memory does not err in this,
query.result: 145 Nænig unwisdom næfre mid swilcum gewinne 146 geworhte ðæt ic wære willende to witanne, 147 gif min gemynd on ðam ne mista,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
148 quanta pareami allor, pensando, avere; 149 né per la fretta dimandare er’ oso, 150 né per me lì potea cosa vedere:
query.error: **English:** 148 as much as I seemed to have then, thinking about it; 149 nor was I bold enough to ask because of the haste, 150 nor could I see anything there for myself:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
151 così m’andava timido e pensoso.
query.error: **English:** 151 thus I went, timid and thoughtful.
query.result: 151 swa ic ferde forht and geþohtfull.
